description:
This course introduces different e-learning environments and e-learning tools and explores ways learning theories can be applied in e-learning design. By the end of this course, you’ll have the ability to design a blended or online learning environment with modules for learning content aimed at different target groups.
OBJECTIVES
 

Gain an overview of the different possibilities and functionalities of e-learning environments.
Develop the ability to critically analyze and assess the didactical effect of an e-learning environment.
Understand learning design principles.
Develop the ability to design and implement e-learning environments.
Apply learning and multimedia theories for the selection and development of e-learning environments.
Apply e-learning to support relevant educational innovation projects.
title: E-Learning Environments and E-learning Design
instructors: Daria Bogdanova and Dr. Chang Zhu
